ast.name: turtle
ast.comment: A library to create turtle programs. #turtle

body.text: Creates a portrait turtle world
Sets the pen down to enable the turtle to draw as it moves.
Lifts the pen up to stop drawing as the turtle moves.
Turns and moves the turtle to the specified location. If the pen is down, it will draw a line as it moves.
Moves the turtle to a specified distance. If the pen is down, it will draw a line as it moves.

Turns the turtle by the specified angle. Angle is in degrees and can be either positive or negative. If the angle is positive, the turtle turns to its right. If it is negative, the turtle turns to its left.
Sets the color of the pen.
Maps the world coordinates to the board coordinates.
Stands for x coordinate. Reports the x coordinate of the current turtle.
Stands for y coordinate. Reports the y coordinate of the current turtle.
Reports the current turtle's heading in degrees. The degrees correspond to those of a compass; 0 degrees is due North, 90 is East, 180 is South, and 270 is West.
Returns the world width.
Returns the world height.

Stands for set heading. Sets the turtle's heading to the specified direction (in degrees). The degrees correspond to those of a compass: 0 degrees is due North, 90 is East, 180 is South, and 270 is West. Right and left turn a turtle a number of degrees from its current heading. Seth makes a turtle point to a specific direction, regardless of its previous heading.
Sets the pen thickness in pixels
Turns clockwise by the specified angle in degrees
Draws a circle.
Gets the board used to draw the turtle
Aligns the turtle with the vector dx, dy
Turtle is a library that emulates the LOGO environment.

The user controls a little turtle that carries a pen. By moving and turning the turtle, one can create tons of crazy drawings. See the [first steps with the turtle](/firststepswithturtle) tutorial to get started.
This implementation uses the [MicroWorlds Logo commands](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_MicroWorlds_Logo_commands).
### coordinates
The turtle world is centered on a portrait screen. x coordinates go from left to right and y coordinates go from bottom to top.
### moving
Use `forward` to move the turtle forward.
You can also go backwards.
### turning
You can turn the turtle left (counter clockwise) or right (clockwise) by a certain amount of degrees. The turtle always starts pointing upwards.
You can also use negative angles.
Or you can simply set the angle
### customizing the pen
You can change the color of the pen
You can change the thickness of the pen.
### pen up, pen down
You can lift and put down the pen. When the pen is lifted, the turtle does not draw anything when moving.
### i'm lost!
Is your turtle lost? Use `go home` to reset its position.
### cleaning and clearing
Cleaning clears the drawing but leaves the turtle as it is. Clearing cleans and gets the turtle home.
### circles
It is possible to draw circle efficiently using the `circle` action.
### faster the moves
The turtle moves slow but you can make it go faster changing the animation rate (pixels per second)
or by turning them off entirely by setting `speed` to zero.
Creates a landscape turtle environment
Gets the picture over which the turtle draws.
Creates an animation that accelerates using a quadratic formula in and out.
Sets the speed of the turtle in steps per seconds. If zero or negative, the animations are disabled.
Moves the turtle to the center of the page coordinates [0 0], pointing up.
Moves the turtle backwards.
Reports a number representing the pen size in pixels of the current turtle. The maximum is 100.
Clears the graphics without changing any turtle's position.
Clears the graphics on the page and returns the current turtle to its home position, facing up.
Returns the steps per second. If the result is negative or zero, the moves are not animated.
Moves the turtle to the designated x y coordinates. The center of the page is [0 0].
Sets the x coordinate of the current turtle. The y coordinate remains unchanged.
Sets the ``y`` coordinate of the current turtle. The ``x`` coordinate remains unchanged.
Stamps a copy of the turtle on the background. The pen does not have to be down to stamp.
Returns the pen color.
Reports the color under the current turtle. The portion of a turtle that recognizes a color is its center.
